Q: Azure Functions SQL trigger delete operation - how to get id of deleted record? A:

Exactamundo. What's the point of an SQL trigger azure function in the first place? Because some app needs to be aware of a change that has been made in a database in the cloud. I would even take this further. It would be nice to have the data from the deleted record available in the change.Item to be able to reference foreign keys if needed.

Anyway, my problem turned out to be that I was using a test table. I changed the name of the primary key. This seems to break the SQL trigger azure function. Oh well.
